definition: Eastern Barbarians, non-Han tribe living to the east of China c 2200 BC
surname Dong
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
non-Han people, esp. to the East of China/barbarians/to wipe out/to exterminate/to tear down/to raze

sentences.english: Houyi doesn t belong to western Yi, but eastern Yi.
sentences.chinese: 后羿属于东夷，而非西夷。

sentences.english: How can we prove that Korean is related to Eastern Yi ethnic groups in Shang Dynasty?
sentences.chinese: 怎么就能证明朝鲜族与东夷族有关系呢？

sentences.english: The evolution of Dong Yi culture is Studied in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 本文即探讨东夷文化的历史沿革。

definition: Han Chinese name for an ancient Central Asia country

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
the Xirong, an ancient ethnic group of Western China from the Zhou Dynasty onwards/Xionites (Central Asian nomads)
Eastern barbarian/ancient ethnic group of northeast frontier of China
Quanrong, Zhou Dynasty ethnic group of present-day western China
Northern Yan of the Sixteen Kingdoms (409-436)
ethnic groups in the north and west of China in ancient times/foreigner/barbarian
ancient people of central Asia during the Han dynasty
Youzhou, ancient province in north Hebei and Liaoning/Fanyang 範陽|范阳 ancient city near modern Beijing
Outer Mongolia (lit. north of the Gobi Desert)
sage kings
Xianbei or Xianbi, group of northern nomadic peoples
Han Dynasty term for the Roman Empire 羅馬帝國|罗马帝国[Luo2 ma3 Di4 guo2]
Korean Goryeo dynasty, 918-1392/Korea, esp. in context of art and culture
different tribe
Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
